climbs.name: North Ridge - West Side
climbs.fa: Armstrong, Sandbo, Woodmansee, Apter, Gibson - July 1977

content.description: Locate the broken NW face from the top of the gulley on the west side of the face.  Multiple options climb generally up then out right avoiding a prow-like steep roof section.  The second pitch climbs a lower angle slab with spaced out pro.  This gains a flat shoulder; move the belay to near a notch, then climb one pitch to the summit area. Class 2 on rubble gains the summit. One rappel and downclimbing gains the shoulder; walk back towards the start of the ridge to locate a small tree with rappel slings; one more rappel from a large block gets you to the ground.
content.protection: Single rack to #2 camalot, long slings
content.location: West side of North Ridge starts below the 5.7/5.8 more direct North Ridge.

pathTokens: Hwy 20 and North Cascades National Park
